primaries.name: AR-23 Liberator
primaries.description: The SEAF standard assault rifle, balancing power, fire rate, and weight for a reliable weapon against smaller targets.

primaries.name: AR-23P Liberator Penetrator
primaries.description: A modified Liberator fitted with a scope and firing armor-piercing rounds, to help users take down armored targets.

primaries.name: AR-23C Liberator Concussive
primaries.description: A modified Liberator firing concussive rounds which do less damage but stagger enemies.

primaries.name: AR-23A Liberator Carbine
primaries.description: A compact version of the Liberator designed to increase viability in close quarters. Has an increased fire rate at the cost of higher spread.

primaries.name: AR-61 Tenderizer
primaries.description: A high-caliber assault rifle with a restrictive magazine size but more stopping power.

secondaries.name: SG-22 Bushwhacker
secondaries.description: A triple-barreled, break-action, sawed-off shotgun. Switch firing modes to fire all three barrels at once.

secondaries.name: P-2 Peacemaker
secondaries.description: The SEAF standard pistol - offering a high fire rate, generous capacity, and fast reloading.

secondaries.name: P-19 Redeemer
secondaries.description: A fully-automatic pistol with an extremely high fire rate, allowing for efficient crowd control.

secondaries.name: GP-31 Grenade Pistol
secondaries.description: A pistol that fires grenades. Must be reloaded between shots.

secondaries.name: LAS-7 Dagger
secondaries.description: A laser pistol that fires a continuous beam. Does not require ammo but can overheat and need to change batteries.

throwables.name: G-6 Frag
throwables.description: An antipersonnel fragmentation grenade. Creates damage over a large area when detonated.

throwables.name: G-10 Incendiary
throwables.description: An incendiary grenade which ignites any targets and terrain within the blast radius. Use with caution.

throwables.name: G-12 High Explosive
throwables.description: A high explosive grenade which damages lightly armored targets. Creates high damage over a small area when detonated.

throwables.name: G-16 Impact
throwables.description: A high explosive grenade which detonates on first impact.

throwables.name: G-13 Incendiary Impact
throwables.description: Detonates on impact, covering the immediate vicinity in self-igniting white phosphorus.

armor.name: FS-37 Ravager
armor.description: Contains many small pockets, allowing the user to evenly distribute weight of ammunition sample, and cool rocks.

armor Passive.name: Engineering Kit
armor Passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of throwables by +2.

armor.name: CW-4 Arctic Ranger
armor.description: Features a utility belt with pockets that can be filled with any number of things, such as pocket knives, mementos from home, and interesting rocks.

armor Passive.name: Scout
armor Passive.description: Markers placed on the map will generate radar scans every 2.0s. Reduces range at which enemies can detect the wearer by 30%.

armor.name: CE-74 Breaker
armor.description: A domestic version of this armor is available for citizens who wish to perform efficient home renovation projects.

armor Passive.name: Engineering Kit
armor Passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of throwables by +2.

armor.name: CE-67 Titan
armor.description: A quality product, this armor can destroy over 300,000 kilometers of fencing with no decline in operational efficiency.

armor Passive.name: Engineering Kit
armor Passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of throwables by +2.

armor.name: CM-21 Trench Paramedic
armor.description: The suit was once designed to hold a variety of battlefield medical equipment. Now it holds a generous supply of stims.

armor Passive.name: Med-Kit
armor Passive.description: Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of stims by +2. Increases stim effect duration by 2.0s.

helmets.name: FS-37 Ravager
helmets.description: Contains many small pockets, allowing the user to evenly distribute weight of ammunition sample, and cool rocks.

helmets.name: CW-4 Arctic Ranger
helmets.description: Features a utility belt with pockets that can be filled with any number of things, such as pocket knives, mementos from home, and interesting rocks.

helmets.name: CE-74 Breaker
helmets.description: A domestic version of this armor is available for citizens who wish to perform efficient home renovation projects.

helmets.name: CE-67 Titan
helmets.description: A quality product, this armor can destroy over 300,000 kilometers of fencing with no decline in operational efficiency.

helmets.name: CM-21 Trench Paramedic
helmets.description: The suit was once designed to hold a variety of battlefield medical equipment. Now it holds a generous supply of stims.

capes.name: Will of the People
capes.description: Contains a grain of sand from Super Earth—so its bearers carry a small piece of Liberty with them, wherever they go.

capes.name: Light of Eternal Liberty
capes.description: The unimpeachable justice of this cape's design is said to blind the enemies of Freedom with its glorious light.

capes.name: Cresting Honor
capes.description: The yellow is the exact shade of the Ministry of Unity's 'Golden Gate', leading to the Chamber of Unanimous Decision.

capes.name: Liberty's Herald
capes.description: The two stripes serve as a reminder of the two pillars of successful military campaigns: attack, and further attack.

capes.name: Foesmasher
capes.description: Durable, waterproof, and thermally-lined, surplus units of this cape are favored by domestic campers, to make tents.

eagle.name: Eagle Strafing Run
eagle.description: A strafing run of the battlefield to clear small targets, delivered almost instantly.

eagle.name: Eagle Airstrike
eagle.description: A barrage of bombs creating a non-targeted carpet of explosions.

eagle.name: Eagle Cluster Bomb
eagle.description: A targeted air strike unable to destroy buildings, but efficient at clearing smaller targets.

eagle.name: Eagle Napalm Strike
eagle.description: A barrage of napalm bombs, creating a wall of fire which will stop enemies in their tracks.

eagle.name: Eagle Smoke Strike
eagle.description: A barrage of smoke grenades, creating a thick smoke screen to block enemies' line of sight.

orbital.name: Orbital Gatling Barrage
orbital.description: A barrage of high explosive rounds, fired from the Destroyer's high speed rotary autocannons.

orbital.name: Orbital Airburst Strike
orbital.description: A projectile which explodes while airborne, creating a deadly rain of shrapnel. Not effective against heavy armor.

orbital.name: Orbital 120mm HE Barrage
orbital.description: A precision artillery salvo over a small area, perfect for taking out concentrated enemy units.

orbital.name: Orbital 380mm HE Barrage
orbital.description: A prolonged barrage, wreaking extended destruction over a large area. Communication with teammates is advised.

orbital.name: Orbital Walking Barrage
orbital.description: A linear artillery barrage which moves at intervals, driving the enemy out from cover while allowing an advance.

support weapons.name: MG-43 Machine Gun
support weapons.description: A machine gun designed for stationary use. Trades higher power for increased recoil and reduced accuracy.

support weapons.name: APW-1 Anti-Materiel Rifle
support weapons.description: A high-caliber sniper rifle effective over long distances against light vehicle armor. This rifle must be aimed downscope.

support weapons.name: M-105 Stalwart
support weapons.description: A compact, low caliber machine gun. Trades power for ease of use, with faster reloading than heavier machine guns.

support weapons.name: EAT-17 Expendable Anti-tank
support weapons.description: A single-use weapon specialized for damaging vehicle armor. Discards after every use.

support weapons.name: GR-8 Recoilless Rifle
support weapons.description: A recoiless rifle effective against vehicle armor. Includes support backpack required for reloading.

backpacks.name: LIFT-850 Jump Pack
backpacks.description: Enables the user to jump higher than 'gravity' and 'safety' would normally allow. Must be charged before use.

backpacks.name: B-1 Supply Pack
backpacks.description: Supply boxes containing ammunition, with a backpack that allows the user to distribute boxes to fellow Helldivers.

backpacks.name: AX/LAS-5 "Guard Dog" Rover
backpacks.description: An autonomous drone equipped with a laser rifle, providing 360° cover. Returns to backpack to cool down.

backpacks.name: SH-20 Ballistic Shield Backpack
backpacks.description: A backpack which can be wielded as a one-handed balistic shield, protecting against small arms fire.

backpacks.name: SH-32 Shield Generator Pack
backpacks.description: Encloses the wearer in a spherical shield which blocks high-speed projectiles. Has a limited lifetime once deployed.

walkers.name: EXO-45 Patriot Exosuit
walkers.description: A heavily-armored walking exosuit equipped with a rocket launcher and a heavy machine gun.

walkers.name: EXO-49 Emancipator Exosuit
walkers.description: A heavily-armored walking exosuit equipped with dual autocannons.

defensive.name: E/MG-101 HMG Emplacement
defensive.description: A manned fortification offering superior firepower against lightly armored targets. Slow to turn, so place it wisely.

defensive.name: A/ARC-3 Tesla Tower
defensive.description: A turret which fires electrical charges at targets in close range. To avoid frendly fire, remain prone.

defensive.name: MD-6 Anti-personnel Minefield
defensive.description: Deploys a defensive anti-personnel minefield, to halt enemy advance.

loading screen tips: Did you know tips are shown during these transition sequences?
Don't die!
Helldivers traveling the galaxy might come across ancient ruins and other curiosities. Just remember: Only a traitor is curious about alien artifacts!
Practice your daily desensitization exercises to ensure you remain unfazed by enemy atrocities.
If at first you don't succeed, dive, dive again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again.
Don't drink and drive.
Use the Eagle Rearm stratagem during calmer periods to ensure you have those Eagle Strikes available when you need them.
Super Earth recommends spending at least 2.4 seconds per mission enjoying the scenery. A happy Helldiver is a deadly Helldiver.
Friendly Fire isn't.
Don't go it alone – join a squad in order to unleash maximum liberation!
Super Earth has many holidays, but the most important is October 26th – Liberty Day!
The Ministry of Expansion tirelessly works to expand the reach of Freedom and secures vital resources for our society to thrive.
The Super Destroyer can only stay in low orbit for a limited time – watch that mission clock!
The closer you are to the edge of the map, the steeper the angle of incoming orbital bombardments. Physics!
Make sure to pick up your fallen squadmates' sample containers. They're critical for our collective scientific progress!
All Stratagems have their strengths and weaknesses. Choose your Stratagem loadout to best fit the mission and your squad composition.
Don't worry – stims have zero addictive properties!* *Study paid for by Permacura. Permacura: put your life in our hands.
Don't forget to take breaks! ... That is, if you want to be remembered as a coward.
While the Helldiver training program is undeniably infallible, you can always repeat your training from the game menu.
Most enemies have both weak spots and armored spots. The S.E.A.F. training manual recommends aiming for the weak spots.
Most weapons have different fire modes or functions – hold Reload to access them.
Nine out of ten doctors agree that a wound to the chest will make you bleed out if unattended.
Remember: Freedom!
Pay attention to these tips! They've been carefully calibrated to ensure your success.
Don't Panic.
As a last resort, you can use melee attacks to fend off enemies. Remember: death is better than cowardice!
The Automatons are equipped with hyper reactive protocols, making them susceptible to suppressive fire. The more you shoot at them, the less accurate they'll be.
Unhappy with who you are? Change your appearance, voice, and personality in the customization chamber. It's that easy!
If an enemy ever attempts to engage in diplomacy, SHOOT THEM. We mustn't believe their lies.
When you're up against the bots, remember the 3 C's: Cover, Courage, and more Cover.
Remember to fill in your C-01 permit before any act that could result in a child.
Failure to complete mission objectives will NOT result in you being sent to a freedom camp, those are merely dissent rumors.
You are Super Earth's Elite. Remember that.
If you notice a squadmate sympathizing with an enemy, report them to your Democracy Officer. Thoughtcrimes kill!
Diving to the ground can be a life-saver, but it also makes you an easy target for melee units.
It pays to be a straight shooter – angled fire might glance off your target or even ricochet into your squadmates!
The longer you stay in a mission, the heavier the enemy presence becomes.
Day and night sides of a planet are visible during mission selection, allowing you to choose the mission that's right for you!
If the enemies just keep coming, find out where they're coming from and unleash hell. Bug hive? Destroy! Bot factory? Destroy!
Every citizen is equally important to the war effort, but Helldivers are the most important.
Check your Ammo by holding the Reload button.
Grenades detonation time starts when you pull back for a throw – time your throw for an air-burst detonation.
More challenging missions yield greater rewards.
If a squadmate dies during a mission, make sure you pick up their dropped samples. There will be time for mourning later!
Reloading discards the remaining rounds in your magazine.
Your stance has a significant impact on accuracy. The S.E.A.F. manual lists the following stances in order of least to most accurate: Moving < Standing < Crouching < Prone.
